seed: I keep overthinking everything at work, and I'm scared I'm going to get fired even though nobody said anything.

transcript.content: I keep overthinking everything at work, and I'm scared I'm going to get fired even though nobody said anything.

It sounds like when you think about work, you worry that you might get fired.  

What makes you think that even if no one has said anything?
I don’t know, it’s just this nagging feeling like I’m always one mistake away from disaster. I can’t shake off the dread, and it just makes me feel so anxious all the time.

It sounds like you're experiencing a lot of  **anxiety**, which is making it hard to feel at ease. 

When you say "I'm always one mistake away from disaster," what kind of mistakes are you thinking about?
Honestly, it could be anything—a simple typo in an email or forgetting to follow up on a project. It just all feels way bigger in my head, like I'm constantly walking on eggshells.

It sounds like when things like typos happen or you forget to follow up,  you feel like everything is much more serious than it actually is. 

Do you think there might be other ways to look at those situations besides feeling like you're "walking on eggshells"?
I guess I know on some level it’s not the end of the world, but the fear just grips me, and I can’t seem to shake it off. It’s like my mind just races and goes to the worst-case scenario every time.

It sounds like you're acknowledging that things aren't necessarily the end of the world, but you still feel overwhelmed by fear.  When your mind races to the worst-case scenario, what do you think might be prompting those thoughts?
I think it’s just this pressure I put on myself to do everything perfectly, like anything less is a total failure. It feels like I can’t let my guard down for even a moment.

It sounds like you feel a lot of  **pressure to do everything perfectly**. 

What makes you think that anything less than perfect would be a total failure?
I guess it comes from feeling like I’ve always had to prove myself, you know? Like if I'm not perfect, then it’s like I’m not enough, and that thought just eats away at me.
It sounds like you feel a lot of pressure to be perfect.  When you think about not being perfect, what comes to mind next?
When I think about not being perfect, it’s this wave of panic hits me, and I picture myself disappointing everyone around me. It feels like all my fears are waiting to pounce if I slip up just once.
It sounds like when you think about "not being perfect," you feel a surge of panic.  Does that feeling make you worry that you'll let everyone down?
Absolutely, it’s like a tidal wave of anxiety crashing over me, and I just can’t shake the idea that I’ll ruin everything. It’s exhausting just thinking about it.
It sounds like you're feeling really overwhelmed by this thought, "I'll ruin everything."  What makes you think that a particular situation might lead to ruining everything?

I don’t know, it’s like I’ve built this image in my head of what “success” looks like, and any little mistake feels like a chink in that armor. I guess I just can’t handle the thought of letting anyone down, especially myself.

It sounds like you have a very clear idea of what success means to you.  When you say "any little mistake feels like a chink in that armor," are you worried about how others might perceive those mistakes?
Yeah, it’s definitely about how others see me. I feel like one slip-up makes me look weak or incompetent, and that just spirals into this huge fear of judgment.

It sounds like you're worried that a mistake would make people think less of you.  

What other thoughts come up when you imagine making a slip-up?
I just picture everyone whispering behind my back, like suddenly I’m the laughingstock or something. It’s this overwhelming shame that makes me want to crawl under a rock and hide.

concepts.term: Social phobia, fear of public speaking (disorder)
